name: Kala Chana Curry
history: Kala Chana Curry, also known as Black Chickpea Curry, is a staple in North Indian cuisine. It has been enjoyed for generations, particularly in vegetarian diets for its high protein content.
description: Kala Chana Curry is made with black chickpeas, simmered in a spicy and flavorful gravy made from onions, tomatoes, and various Indian spices. It's a nutritious and hearty dish, often served with rice or flatbreads.

instructions.title: Soak and Cook the Chickpeas
instructions.description: Soak the kala chana overnight. Drain and cook in a pressure cooker or pot with salt and enough water until they are soft yet retain their shape.

instructions.title: Prepare the Curry
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds, followed by onions, ginger-garlic paste, and green chilies. Saut√© until onions turn golden. Add pureed tomatoes, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates from the masala.

instructions.title: Combine and Simmer
instructions.description: Add the cooked chickpeas to the masala along with some water for gravy. Simmer for 10-15 minutes. Stir in garam masala.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread like roti or naan.

tips: Pressure cooking the chickpeas with salt helps them absorb flavor.
The consistency of the curry can be adjusted as per preference, ranging from thick to moderately thin.
variations: Chana Masala: Substitute kala chana with regular chickpeas (garbanzo beans) for a different variation.
Kala Chana Dry: Reduce the amount of water for a dry version, suitable as a side dish.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot. Add a little water if the curry has thickened too much during storage.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving bowl, accompanied by a side of sliced onions and lemon wedges.
Sprinkle a pinch of garam masala on top before serving for added aroma.
